events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker discussing a decision to pardon President Nixon. He describes the decision as being made "solely on my own judgement," for the "national interest." The speaker continues, noting it was important to "clear the decks" when taking over the White House. He explains that he was spending 30% of his time arguing with lawyers over Nixon's tapes and papers, and that he should have been focusing on the country's more pressing issues. Finally, the man discusses making the decision to pardon Nixon to "get the matter out of my hands." The speech is interrupted by an affirmative female voice.
